New Records: Brayan Bello recorded his best start in the big leagues, allowing just two hits and a walk while striking out nine over eight scoreless innings.
Key Match Events: Brayan Bello mixed his pitches expertly, never needing more than 16 pitches an inning.
Tyler O'Neill crushed a two-run homer for insurance in the eighth inning.
Pre-Game Insights: Brayan Bello has been working on incorporating the four-seamer into his pitch mix, which he reintroduced in early July.
Post-Match Reflections: Brayan Bello expressed pride in his performance and felt mentally focused after being allowed to pitch into the eighth inning.
The win helped the Red Sox pull within three games of the third wild-card spot.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Red Sox rotation has dominated the season, with Brayan Bello being the outlier in the first few months.
Brayan Bello has slowly dipped his ERA under 5.00 over the past two months.
Others: The Minnesota Twins lost on Wednesday, which helped the Red Sox pull within three games of the third wild-card spot.
Pre-Game Quotes: Manager Alex Cora said, "That was amazing. That was fun to watch. Under control. Pitch by pitch, he didn’t get ahead, right? The sinker was good. The four-seamer was great. The change up, slider was outstanding."
Post-Game Quotes: Brayan Bello said, "I definitely think that was one of my better starts in the big leagues, in all phases, I thought I was one of the best."
Brayan Bello said, "I do believe he’s still a work in progress."
